turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Geography of the United Kingdom.
turn.1: What are the largest and smallest British overseas territories?
turn.2: The British Antarctic Territory, which covers an area of 1,709,400 km is geographically the largest of the British Overseas Territories followed by the Falkland Islands which covers an area of 12,173 km.
turn.3: What is the total area of all the British overseas territories together?
turn.4: The remaining twelve overseas territories cover an area 5,997 km.
turn.5: What countries have a land area similar to or larger than the British overseas territories?
turn.6: Other countries with very similar land areas to the United Kingdom include Guinea (slightly larger), Uganda, Ghana and Romania (all slightly smaller).
turn.7: Is the UK the largest country in terms of land area in Europe?
turn.8: The UK is the world's 80th largest country by land area and the 10th largest in Europe (if European Russia is included).
turn.9: What is the topography of the UK?
turn.10: The physical geography of the UK varies greatly.
turn.11: Are there any countries in the UK that are higher than others?
turn.12: England consists of mostly lowland terrain, with upland or mountainous terrain only found north-west of the Tees-Exe line.
